solution_line_template: First find the screen area of Bill's TV: {bill_tv_width} inches * {bill_tv_length} inches = <<{bill_tv_width}*{bill_tv_length}={bill_tv_area}>>{bill_tv_area} square inches
Then find the screen area of Bob's TV: {bob_tv_width} inches * {bob_tv_length} inches = <<{bob_tv_width}*{bob_tv_length}={bob_tv_area}>>{bob_tv_area} square inches

Then subtract the size of the smaller TV from the size of the bigger TV to find the size difference: {bill_tv_area} square inches - {bob_tv_area} square inches = <<{bill_tv_area}-{bob_tv_area}={area_difference}>>{area_difference} square inches

Then multiply the size difference by the weight per square inch to find the weight difference: {area_difference} square inches * {weight_per_sq_inch} oz/square inch = <<{area_difference}*{weight_per_sq_inch}={weight_difference_oz}>>{weight_difference_oz} oz

Then divide the weight difference in ounces by the number of ounces per pound to find the weight difference in pounds: {weight_difference_oz} oz / {ounces_per_pound} oz/pound = <<{weight_difference_oz}/{ounces_per_pound}={weight_difference_pounds}>>{weight_difference_pounds} pounds
